title: TimtheYoutuber
author: TimtheYoutuber
created_time: November 26, 2023, 06:03:44 PMLast edit: January 14, 2024, 04:28:25 PM by TimtheYoutuber
content: ‚öΩüèÄüèàSportsbooks offer great sign on bonuses that you can hedge to make thousands of dollars if you're in a legal state. Video on how to make money with promotions: https://youtu.be/UWJ6JGgIp4EYou can also get my free guide on it here. You can create a new email if you want. If you live in the US and don't know what books are available to you, check out the table https://positivebetting.com/sports-book-availability *No ref links or anything like that, you sign up from the official sites that you have. I live in NY, so I don't have access to a lot of sites, but was still able to make a thousand on just sign ups. Must be a new customer. How much have you guys made?

comments.author: TimtheYoutuber
comments.body: I know a lot of people think the RIO is so small so you don't make alot, but if your first bet is $1-2k then you can actually make $10k+ per month as long as you have a bankroll that allows you to make a few bets a day.

comments.author: Marvelman
comments.body: Making money off online casino signup bonuses seems tempting, but it's rarely easy money.¬† These promotions come with fine print - like wagering requirements that force you to gamble away buckets of money before you can withdraw a cent. Say a casino offers you $100 free.¬† Nice! But you might need to place $2,000 in bets before cashing out.¬† That's a 20x rollover.¬† Good luck! You'll probably lose way before hitting that target.¬† Most bonus hunters end up losing money in the long run.

comments.author: TimtheYoutuber
comments.body: Quote from: Marvelman on November 27, 2023, 04:39:27 PMMaking money off online casino signup bonuses seems tempting, but it's rarely easy money. ¬†These promotions come with fine print - like wagering requirements that force you to gamble away buckets of money before you can withdraw a cent. Say a casino offers you $100 free. ¬†Nice! But you might need to place $2,000 in bets before cashing out. ¬†That's a 20x rollover. ¬†Good luck! You'll probably lose way before hitting that target. ¬†Most bonus hunters end up losing money in the long run.I've mainly only seen this with slot casinos or crypto casinos. Major sportsbooks in the US that are regulated, do offer a variety of promotions. But most are deposit promotions and play through 1x, along with free bets. I can help anyone 1:1 on how to maximize, if they're in the US and in a legal state.

comments.author: TimtheYoutuber
comments.body: I'm interested to know. How much have you guys made arbitrage betting? Or do you guys only straight bet?

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: Quote from: Marvelman on November 27, 2023, 04:39:27 PMMaking money off online casino signup bonuses seems tempting, but it's rarely easy money.¬† These promotions come with fine print - like wagering requirements that force you to gamble away buckets of money before you can withdraw a cent. Say a casino offers you $100 free.¬† Nice! But you might need to place $2,000 in bets before cashing out.¬† That's a 20x rollover.¬† Good luck! You'll probably lose way before hitting that target.¬† Most bonus hunters end up losing money in the long run.with the money you get for free, whatever the roll over is doesn't matter to me. What is clear from this free money is that we only focus on betting. If we lose with the bonus, it's still not our own money, there's nothing to lose for us. If at that time we are in a good position to win, but the withdrawal is still not open because it has not reached the minimum, I will usually use it by playing slots with the smallest nominal amount. Of course this is not to be imitated, what is clear is that regarding roll over bonuses, it is normal for the provider to apply them.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Marvelman on November 27, 2023, 04:39:27 PMMaking money off online casino signup bonuses seems tempting, but it's rarely easy money.¬† These promotions come with fine print - like wagering requirements that force you to gamble away buckets of money before you can withdraw a cent. Say a casino offers you $100 free.¬† Nice! But you might need to place $2,000 in bets before cashing out.¬† That's a 20x rollover.¬† Good luck! You'll probably lose way before hitting that target.¬† Most bonus hunters end up losing money in the long run.I‚Äôd have to agree with this. OP makes it sound like you just register for a few sites and withdraw the bonuses. Sites wouldn‚Äôt offer these sorts of bonuses if it wasn‚Äôt profitable for them to do so and most people don‚Äôt sign up and verify their identity just to do the minimum and withdraw. I think people would be better to focus on the gaming experience and not the bonuses.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: TimtheYoutuber on December 26, 2023, 06:12:20 PMI'm interested to know. How much have you guys made arbitrage betting? Or do you guys only straight bet?I just do straight betting.In actuality, how much you've been making with arbitrage betting? I don't have that much preference in terms of arbitrage because I just don't find it well for me. But if this is working perfectly for you, I'm guessing that you're making a lot of money from doing it. Isn't it?

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: masulum on December 26, 2023, 06:33:22 PMQuote from: Marvelman on November 27, 2023, 04:39:27 PMMaking money off online casino signup bonuses seems tempting, but it's rarely easy money.¬† These promotions come with fine print - like wagering requirements that force you to gamble away buckets of money before you can withdraw a cent. Say a casino offers you $100 free.¬† Nice! But you might need to place $2,000 in bets before cashing out.¬† That's a 20x rollover.¬† Good luck! You'll probably lose way before hitting that target.¬† Most bonus hunters end up losing money in the long run.with the money you get for free, whatever the roll over is doesn't matter to me. What is clear from this free money is that we only focus on betting. If we lose with the bonus, it's still not our own money, there's nothing to lose for us. If at that time we are in a good position to win, but the withdrawal is still not open because it has not reached the minimum, I will usually use it by playing slots with the smallest nominal amount. Of course this is not to be imitated, what is clear is that regarding roll over bonuses, it is normal for the provider to apply them.Well ofcourse providers wouldn't want its promotion to be abused by players if they would allow them to withdraw after signing up. The motive is to push the gamblers to make a deposit as part of their marketing strategy. But that's indeed true; the best way to make full use of these bonuses is to consume it to their platform and hope to win and meet the minimum for withdrawal. However odds won't be with the usual 'coz again, providers would limit the chances of winning big or at least adjust the rewards less than with the actual game when you make a deposit. Therefore it would be hard to achieve winning thousands just because of it unless you are lucky enough to do so.There's no easy money. Given that we are in gambling industry, no such thing will exist.The goal of these rewards is to allow players to test their platform and leave an impression on that experience for them to be persuaded engaging to that platform. There's realli nothing wrong with it other than people expecting to make a living oit of such offer.

comments.author: masulum
comments.body: Quote from: Yatsan on December 26, 2023, 07:26:16 PMWell ofcourse providers wouldn't want its promotion to be abused by players if they would allow them to withdraw after signing up. The motive is to push the gamblers to make a deposit as part of their marketing strategy. But that's indeed true; the best way to make full use of these bonuses is to consume it to their platform and hope to win and meet the minimum for withdrawal. However odds won't be with the usual 'coz again, providers would limit the chances of winning big or at least adjust the rewards less than with the actual game when you make a deposit. Therefore it would be hard to achieve winning thousands just because of it unless you are lucky enough to do so.There's no easy money. Given that we are in gambling industry, no such thing will exist.The goal of these rewards is to allow players to test their platform and leave an impression on that experience for them to be persuaded engaging to that platform. There's realli nothing wrong with it other than people expecting to make a living oit of such offer.That's right, currently most of provider will give a bonus if someone has made a deposit. Even from this deposit the company will apply regulations with at least 1x turn over. AFAIK, the turnover between bonus and deposit is also separated by the system. So, even if we are finished with the bonus turnover, we still have to complete the deposit turnover. If both are not met, we still will not be able to make a withdrawal.Regarding the game system, I am not convinced by the notion that there is a difference between playing with bonus money and deposits. Many people say that it is difficult to win from bonuses, but I have experienced several times from the under $ 10 cashback bonus that I got, I can win more than $ 100, so I think maybe the assumption is that bonuses (not spins bonuses) don't give good wins, only myth, or indeed as you say, on that day I had better luck. What is clear, if that is implemented, doesn't that mean that the provider is committing fraud if they arrange for anyone who gambles from the bonus to lose more.

comments.author: TimtheYoutuber
comments.body: Anyone else arbitrage sports betting? If you want to learn PM me and I would be glad to help.How much have you guys made, and do you have any other tips or methods? Once you sign up to the regulated sites and hedge the profits, you're pretty much done with promotions unless you arbitrage and can earn VIP statues.

comments.author: Hirose UK
comments.body: Quote from: TimtheYoutuber on February 01, 2024, 12:07:38 PMAnyone else arbitrage sports betting? If you want to learn PM me and I would be glad to help.Hahaha this is quite good, you offer help to learn about Arbitrage betting and of course those who are curious will definitely try it.It just that when you do this, provide assistance to those who want to learn with Arbitrage betting, you have to be prepared for the consequences that you have to accept.What is worrying is if there are mistakes that occur where you might be blamed if those who are learning experience defeat or loss.QuoteHow much have you guys made, and do you have any other tips or methods? Once you sign up to the regulated sites and hedge the profits, you're pretty much done with promotions unless you arbitrage and can earn VIP statues.Honestly, I myself don't really like Arbitrage betting because this bet will require more capital at stake because have to bet on more than 2 gambling sites.And regarding profits I don't really care, as long as I still get pleasure then obviously whatever results are given I will gladly accept them.This is not about profit but how to enjoy gambling because if gamble happily can get any profit, including VIP benefits.
